website_summaries.verdict: While I have some small reservation about their fit, the Klipsch T5 True Wireless are worth checking out if you're considering a set a premium set of true wireless headphones.
pros: The Klipsch T5 True Wireless is sturdily built, delivers excellent sound if you get a tight seal and has strong battery life
Its Zippo-inspired charging case is sleek, solid and features USB-C charging

website_summaries.verdict: The Klipsch T5 True Wireless earphones sound excellent and look cool, but are priced just a little too high.
pros: Excellent audio performance with rich bass depth and bright, clear highs

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon order of these was delayed, and I managed to buy in a shop, They sound incredible. Unfortunately the first started rattling with a loose button on the left. They were returned and replaced. The second pair rattled out of the box and the charging case hinge was aligned. They are being returned, as are the Amazon ones which eventually arrived (the poor build quality meant I am moving to something else). Very disappointing as I am (was) a Klipsch fan.
customer_reviews.author: JMack

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but there's a major connectivity problems.
customer_reviews.text: Actually the sound is really good but almost every day you are going to have issues connecting the earbuds to the phone, it's a well known problem, one day usually the dominant pair got stuck and don't connect, after resetting, pairing and setting it all again, fail. The connect app has been launched and still many problems.
customer_reviews.author: c0rsa1r

customer_reviews.title: Easy pairing but could do better on Sound
customer_reviews.text: Handles the high notes well - crisp and clear - but lacking on the lower notes. Would say the Klipsch R6 does a better job in terms of the sound quality, especially the lower beats/bass. But it isn't too bad though probably would have expected Klipsch to do a better job. The microphones are also muffled apparently. Probably ok for a pair of wireless earphones but if you've got another pair of (great) Klipsch earphones don't be in a rush to change out of that
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these to start with but having problems with them everyday! No connection, one bus stops as I’m am listening to it then can’t reconnect. Such as shame and tried to get help but they just told me to reset them and that’s a bit of a pain to do twice a day!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Paterson

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Lots of detail exultant sound can't go wrong with klipsch don't no why people marking them down thare are superb.
customer_reviews.author: malcolm wilson

customer_reviews.title: Dont be misguided by negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: Ansolutely fantastic- dont go by the negative reviews, I did not find anything wrong/negative about these fab ear buds!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Mayank Bhalla

customer_reviews.title: OK for music and not good for phone calls
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned these headphones for about a month now. I’ve missed my return window or I would be returning these. The headphones have Great battery life, a very convent charging case, OK sound quality, but horrible phone call performance. Specifically the earphones get out of sync creating an echoing sound. The biggest issue is the fact people have significant trouble hearing me when I talk. Given I’m on conference calls and travel a lot on planes I want a product that both plays music and handles calls pretty good. In the end these do music at an acceptable level but phone performance is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Family

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t connect to Bluetooth and size too big!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how well they work because it didn’t even connect to my iphone 10. Also, the earphones didn’t fit my ears. It stuck out too much. It’s made for people with bigger sized ears only.
customer_reviews.author: mark_c

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought these new headphones and absolutely love them! Great battery life, great sound and a cool case which resembles my Dad's old Zippo lighter! Plus, they are so comfortable that I can wear them on an entire cross country flight without ANY discomfort....which is perfect when the dude next to you is sawing logs...
customer_reviews.author: 2Bier

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: JUNK!!!!!! Sound quality is good when they work. Bluetooth cuts out. One side will lose connection then comeback. Not what you would expect from a 200$ pair of earbuds
customer_reviews.author: Jkettell

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth ear buds!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these earbuds for several long airline flights thus far. I have used Bluetooth earbuds for years now, but the type with wires between them. Having no wires is great! I had no trouble changing the listening volume just by adjusting the sound at the iPhone manual controls. If the buds came with iOS software for control, I might use it, but I see little additional value to be gained from software. The recharging case is a bit large for carrying in your pocket, but it works great. I have Klipsch speakers for my home theater system, and I love them. These ear buds offer many of the same sound qualities.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: A Swing and a Miss. Love Klipsch but not the T5
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. As other have said in reviews there are two big cons that make this product a non starter: 1) They don’t stay in your ear and Klipsch changed the mount so you can’t easily buy aftermarket pads 2) Even when it is inserted correctly the sound is very flat. The highs and lows do not pop. I love Klipsch. They missed the mark with this product. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Zahe Pitts

customer_reviews.title: They just simply do not work.
customer_reviews.text: Getting both earbuds to connect to your phone via Bluetooth is so much of a hassle that the fantastic audio quality that I'd usually expect from klipsch isn't even worth discussing. Klipsch should stick with speakers, home audio and wired headphones. Bluetooth is definitely not their game.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Bonelli

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Sound and Noise Isolation
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound amazing and fit comfortably. Be sure to pair only one of the headphones, the other will pair of that one and simplify things on the phone side. Also try different angles of how the earpiece is oriented. I had to twist them around a little bit but once they sealed, the rest of the world went away and I was left to rock out in peace. The case is really well made and feels robust, the battery life is great and the sound quality is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Lusk

customer_reviews.title: Stay Clear Of These Things
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely disappointed. I left my Bose Soundlink Earbuds in my Jeep and don’t have access to my Jeep currently. So I decided to buy another pair or earbuds for the gym. These are positively awful. Aside from them not staying in my ear and the sound quality being just okay - now they are experiencing technical issues. Requiring pairing and re pairing frequently sometimes only one of the earbuds wants to play music. The distance range sucks. I am completely disappointed. I would have sent them back but I didn’t want to be inconvenienced any further. On the other hand the Bose ear buds were fantastic. Highly recommend those. These were terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kane

customer_reviews.title: Nuanced Soundstage for Music, Horrible Call Quality, Major Drop Outs
customer_reviews.text: After using the Klipsch earbuds for a while I realized that the call quality is awful. They are good for music but not for calls at all. They drop out constantly while walking. (deal breaker) Still, no Klipsch Connect app which is very disappointing. These are going back! Not recommended. I've reset them twice with good results but I should not have to do this. My Jabra's were set up once and always worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot maintain pairing with each other
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds cannot maintain pairing with each other. One will cut out repeatedly during use. Don't even think of turning your head. Expect to have weird audio events when the audio is out of sync between the earbuds, or apparently pumped to each earbud simultaneously. Expect to do a lot of returning to the case to re-sync with each other, unless you're out on a walk and the case is at home, in which case just stick one in your pocket. I am on my second set because the first reused to pair with each other at all. The second set is only marginally better. Too bad, because the charging case is beautiful and they fit well. Stylish trash.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald W.

customer_reviews.title: Love em! Update
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what some the hate is for these I love them! They connected right up to my iPhone 11 when I take them out of the case they reconnect as well no issues. Sound is great good bass and highs. Not quite as much bass as my Sony Xtra Bass buds but dang close I’m keeping these a bargain for $89.... Update I made the mistake of doing the factory update with the Klipsch app the update was a pain to get it installed and after the install they would not connect reliably anymore sadly I ended up sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: William J, Graham

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch Quality 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Well I am commenting because there had been a few disappointments in previous reviews, I downloaded the app and updated the software, and this allows you to dial in the EQ, it makes a big difference, I just received them this evening, so far they are Awesome, ordered a pair for the wife, I got the Black she is getting the silver, I am not easily impressed, for the price they are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri Lyle Bird

customer_reviews.title: DONOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Only the left earbud works. Sounds shallow and tinny. No low end. The case ways a ton. Way to heavy. The right ear bud is dead. Klipsch has no way I've found to successfully get through to customer service on the phone or on line. I'll stick with my 'cheap' JBL earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Niels Thiess

customer_reviews.title: Sucktacular
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these earphones s*ks... They don't fit properly, they fall out VERY easily when running, and (like many other reviewers have said) they have an unstable connection. And I haven't even gotten to how HORRIBLE they sound! Never thought I'd see the day when a product made Bose Sport Wireless look good... and yet here we are.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Really like these earphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these earphones for specifically one use only and that was to use with my iPod to listen to music at work. I have been using corded Klipsch earphones and have always been really happy with the sound and fit. The cord is a hassle at my desk. So I went with these since I had great experience with the manufacturer and I have not been disappointed. They fit great just as my other Klipsch products and they sound even better. I have had no setup problems or any sound quality issues at all. They were pricey but at this point are worth the money. They were definitely a good choice for me. Would recommend to others. Kevin
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tenney

customer_reviews.title: Not quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Received these today and tried them out. Comes with three sets of earbuds...none of them fit very well for me. The sound is tinny with little bass. There is supposed to be an app, but according to the Klipsch website, the app is not available because of issues they are having with it, and they don't know when it will be available. I do like the compact charging station. The instructions that come with them is just pictures that illustrate how to turn on/off/volume up/down. To really understand how to work the unit and pair the unit, you need to go to the website and watch the informational videos. I am returning these.
customer_reviews.author: michael Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I tried, I really did, but klipsh failed miserably on these headphones. My anker soundbuds curve sound better for just $25... They are uncomfortable, they sound lame, bass is poor, battery does not charge over 80% -never-, does not last long, one side drains faster than the other.... The only thing that's cool is the case, beautiful case, it deserved a better product inside... I won't keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Marchezini

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: One of the best earbuds out there in terms of sound and quality. I don't understand why all the negative comments. + Sounds amazing can hear instruments in the background. Bass is booming if you use the proper mp3 player with eq adjustment. + Battery life lasts forever on a charge. + Classy looking and lightweight. - Fit is a hit or miss, but holds up well. Would not recommend for gym though.
customer_reviews.author: Simple_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality with some small issues
customer_reviews.text: The sound and build on these are fantastic, the battery life is great, the case is really solid, I just really love these. The only issue I have is that the connection cuts in and out every once in a while, not for very long at all but it can get annoying. I don't really see that as a huge deal but others might. I'd recommend them. 4.5/5
customer_reviews.author: Ethan B

customer_reviews.title: Had to send them back
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble from the first second as I had trouble getting these to pair. When I finally got them paired I went for a walk. After walking for about ten minutes the left earbud went silent. I tried to pair them again and could only get the right or left to pair, but not both. I found the only way I could get both to work is to put them back in the case and pull them out, but both would only work for a short time before one would shut off. Everywhere I went I had to carry the case. After just three days I decided to return them and bought a Sony wireless ones that work fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Launiere

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible audio quality! Better than my sennheiser momentum 2.0 headphones (not true wireless) destroys my Galaxy Buds no questions asked. I did have a bit of a pain getting these to update firmware to use the app, but pairing has been a non-issue. The highs are crisp, the lows are way better than expected. Very rich audio. Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy these
customer_reviews.text: I'm shocked what a low quality and thoughtless product Klispch has put out here. First off, they stick out of your ears like some kinda sick joke even with a perfect seal (or at least they did for me). They don't hold in well despite the tips you use and at that, the sound quality was washed out in comparison to my Galaxy Buds. Sent them back, not one bit impressed coming from a Klipsch fan. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been eyeing the T5 for the longest time as I’ve been so accustomed to their comfortable patented oval ear plugs and what a DISAPPOINTMENT it has been with the T5! The left ear piece pairs erratically and when it does, the signal keeps dropping! To me, it’s no different to any China knock off with this kind of performance! Dear Klipsch, I expected minimal standards but the T5 is a let down! Should have saved up for the Apple :(
customer_reviews.author: Collin Tan

customer_reviews.title: Overall good.
customer_reviews.text: They took a few months to break in. During the break in period the signal dropped out but was easily fixed by shutting down all applications and restarting the phone a little frustrating. Excellent sound quality. I remove one bud when on the phone because I like to hear while speaking, canceling works by blocking all sound. Over all good, skipping songs is problematic because you have to push the button twice. This push puts pressure on your eardrum. I recommend usind using the phone to change tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Endarkened

customer_reviews.title: Giving up. Back to Apple
customer_reviews.text: Day 2 and ready to give up. Bluetooth configuration, the setup app, firmware update, instructions, and the controls and lights. I’ve never spent more than a minute with new AirPods. These keep getting confused with multiple L and R instances, endless blinking codes showing status, and the touch/button surface on back too sensitive. It’s like a crying baby — just no fun. I’m good at this stuff and can’t seem to get this right and just listen. Notice I haven’t mentioned sound quality? I’ll get to that if I ever fix the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: PISS POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for less than 2 months and they are already broke. The right one only works sometimes, cuts in and out (Only the right one). I'm disappointed, I figured these would be Klipsch Quality but they are more like an over priced Dollar Store brand. Terrible and would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Redlov31 R.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but...
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these is good, better than any other true wireless I tried, but the case is oddly sized and heavy so you cant actually carry it in you pocket. Also it has a lot of connectivity issues, so it takes a bit to start listening each time, definitely when comparing to the samsung galaxy bud, but also if you compare them to the sennheiser momentum wireless.
customer_reviews.author: gs

customer_reviews.title: Way too hard to update, ABSOLUTELY NO SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE** I am returning my FOURTH pair because I cannot update them, and Klipsch has been NO help, I have emailed, called, contacted on Facebook, Twitter, submitted a support request, and nothing, just an occasional email that says "We haven't forgot about you"...............I'm pretty sure they have at this point. These by far are the WORST to set up! I have had 2 pairs that the left one bricks after trying to update. The 3rd pair will here tomorrow, I think I'm going to call support and have them walk me through it
customer_reviews.author: It's Me

customer_reviews.title: Not for working out with...
customer_reviews.text: I had research wireless earbuds for months. Figure it was time to upgrade from my 2014 Klipsch S4i wired headphones. Of course I love my S4i so much when I saw these T5’s on sale I picked up a set. The sound is nice and easy set up. But where they fail is fitment. If you’re looking for earbuds to just wear than get these. But if you have any plans to do and physical work with them, look elsewhere. From walking to lawn are to running the earbuds consistently fall out of my ear. This is disappointing considering how well my S4i earbuds fit.
customer_reviews.author: Classified

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stay in
customer_reviews.text: Came with three cone-shaped tips, none of which kept the buds in place (and they stick out pretty far, which doesn't help). Had to return for that reason. Can't comment on sound quality for that reason. Case is impressive, metal and very nice. Buds require pressing to operate (rather than touch-sensitive controls of some higher-end buds) so you need to basically push them into your ears to control them. If they had come with a wider selection of tips that may have done the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Lothar

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound ruined by questionable product
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, but ultimately runined by the connection drops. I don't undersyand why Klipsch has flat out lied to the public about a fabled app to fix the issues, which implies they knew there would be connection issues in the first place. It is so frustrating because I want to love these but I just can't get over the bluetooth issue. Klipsch, if you can release an unfinished product, you can at least release an unfinished app to give us some sliver of hope that things will work out. Sincerely, a once loyal fan. UPDATE: the black ones are the way to go. No issues present.
customer_reviews.author: Mortis Creek

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound, Horrible Fit
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good, a little more on the warm side, but it's a pleasing, laid-back listen. The fit, well, it's challenging to say the least. Not only do they insert deeply in your ear, they also are top-heavy, so they absolutely do not stay in place. Hardly the fit/comfort that's advertised. Also, they've promised an App since the Summer, but the date has been constantly pushed back. Last they said, it would be early November, well it's now December...
customer_reviews.author: hifi80sman

customer_reviews.title: Best I have owned.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sounding earbuds I have owned. They are plenty loud and clear. You can use either earbud by itself or together. Battery life is excellent. I listen to audiobooks all day about 10 hours without placing them in the case,they still have charge left. They are easy to clean as they have an inner plastic piece that debris accumulates on .
customer_reviews.author: Steelgator

customer_reviews.title: S
customer_reviews.text: I have been a plantronic bluetooth wearer for several years, but as time goes on things change so I thought I try these, they arrive look nice fellas good sounds good phone calls good, staying in ear terrible, I watched videos, twisted them in differently, tried different tips, but nothing they only stayed in when I stood or sat still when I go walking or move around they slide out. So yes I returned them for some other brand I'm using now and loving so far...they're called xclear
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Priz

customer_reviews.title: Overall great,  with a few bugs.
customer_reviews.text: Case/charger is top quality. Battery life is great. Sound quality is great. But volume max is not exceptionally loud. Occasionally drop out while outside, even when phone is in pocket. Pairing is fast, usually pairs before it gets into my ears after removed from case. Still fit my ears a little loose, even with largest inserts.
customer_reviews.author: NDdirt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sounds but avoid the Klipsch Connect app
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the first set that was sent to me was defective. The right earbud won't power on. I have to return them for replacement. The earbuds themselves are very good. Sound quality is excellent with balanced highs and lows. However, don't make the mistake of downloading the Klipsch Connect app. It doesn't work. Klipsch should be ashamed of this. They released the app prematurely. It has a lot of glitches. Forget the app, the earbuds work well as is without the app.
customer_reviews.author: R. Locsin

customer_reviews.title: Sound fantastic. Fancy case
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I’m not a super techie girl but I do know that these fit and sound way better than the AirPods my boyfriend bought me for my b-day a few months back. I’m sold on these little earphones. The case is sort of elegant too which I didn’t count on from a headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Bean Dip

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound... If They Fit In Your Ears
customer_reviews.text: Being a long time Klipsch fan, I was looking forward to hearing these. However, after trying all three 'dome' sizes, they did not fit my or my wife's ears. Only when we held them in with our hands did the Klipsch sound appear -- must be a bone-conduction design. I did make one Bluetooth call. The sound quality was good in both directions. Looks like for me, shopping for ear buds is best done in the store, to try before buying.
customer_reviews.author: curtcass

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use the App
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good. Stays in ears well. Connection is not as good as others I have owned, but was made better by choosing which headphone was dominant. Fatal flaw is the Klipsch Connect App. I downloaded it to see how the headphones would sound with different EQ. However, it said I needed to update the firmware to use it. I followed all the directions exactly. It got 100% on the left side and rebooted. Then I got an error that the update didn’t work and my left headphone is bricked. Nothing happens when you take it out of the case. It has now been 4 days and I have yet to hear back from Klipsch support.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmik L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Beware Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Have had for apx 3 months now. Right earbud stopped charging and is dead. Tried all the tips....factory reset. Let both charge die. Recharge etc. Amazon refers you to Klipsch. Klipsch doesn’t answer (sat on hold for 15 minutes with no answer). Really wanted to love them but can’t get over fact they’ve failed and no one helping Update- Klipsch customer service contacted me and have rectified the situation. They were helpful and are sending replacement ear bud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these headphone/ear buds suffer from bad drop out/ loss of signal if you move at all!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great! The battery has to be charged every two days even if you do not use the earbuds. These ear buds will cut out / loss the blue tooth connection during use if you move the least little bit. This is totally unacceptable!!!! If you sit perfectly still the connection is perfect. If you have sit perfectly still to maintain the blue tooth connection. This defeats the whole reason for purchasing WIRELESS EARBUDS !!! Bad purchase, I did not discover this problem till after the return window had closed. So I have costly paper weight now !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Hanse

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I was worried they would fall out when I run/workout but they stay In really well. They sound amazing, pair easily, last forever and I’m very happy with my purchase. I do wish the app would come out but I can wait.
customer_reviews.author: Cody75

customer_reviews.title: Software absolutely abysmal
customer_reviews.text: The buds themselves seem pretty decent although I was getting some bluetooth drops. But I downloaded the app so I could update the firmware as recommended...I spent the next 3 hours trying to get the app to connect and work. At the end of the 3 hours, the right bud was totally bricked. Save yourself a headache and go with a company that knows software.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality is Great, but Chintzy Quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fantastic on these, but the quality of the actual earbuds are horrible. The connection buttons are wobbly and they don't feel solid. So chintzy in fact, the right button has jammed on my current pair. Not sure what's going on, but I am going to try and exchange these.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Park

customer_reviews.title: Get something else
customer_reviews.text: Almost unusable. App and headset won't work together. Spent a few hours trying to get things to work together with little to luck. Fine if you like highs and mids, bass is abysmal. Even tweaking my eq on my phone makes very little difference. Even for the price of about 80$ I paid for them. They are easy beat out by Sony extra bass earbuds (wired) for about 35$. I've had these for about 6 hours and feel like crushing them under my trucks tires. Not even worth trying to get a refund....
customer_reviews.author: John Zielke

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds Keep Crashing
customer_reviews.text: They used to be great but after a few months the right earbud started crashing. No matter how many times I reset them and repair them to my phone, the right earbud crashes after a few minutes of playback. It makes the same loud BRRRRRRRRRR sound windows makes when it blue screens. It seems to be a fairly common issue, but it makes them literally unusable. Doesn't seem like this is going to get a firmware update or anything, seeing as they haven't released that app they promised either. Overall, the sound quality is great, but it's not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Puplip

customer_reviews.title: Be Frankenstein
customer_reviews.text: I like them. I contacted support because I thought I need a firmware upgrade but The problem was the ear plug size. They ship with the medium size plug and I needed the larger one. Once I did that they sounded great. My mistake I thought the black would have the copper touch but only the silver does. Black with the copper would have been sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: These things are absolute garbage. I can't rate the sound quality because I couldn't get them to stay in my ears for more than a few seconds. The design is so poor. There is nothing to hold them in your ears except the rubber tip, and even if I jam them in my ears to the point of pain, they still fall out the second I start to move. These things are going right back to Amazoon.
customer_reviews.author: Ribald

customer_reviews.title: Too loud, good passive noise suppression, not enough tip sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Positive: Good sound quality. The tips do a good job passively blocking outside noise. Negative: The sounds was too loud even on the lowest volume, I had to change mixer settings to reduce it further. The smallest silicone times must be for an infant, and the medium tips were too big for me. It is impossible to get alternative tips that fit these buds.
customer_reviews.author: C. Law

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch is the best.
customer_reviews.text: Wow these Rock! The sound is top notch just like any klipsch product. I have had many wired klipsch head phones and these are even better. They block almost all sounds without having to blast them. Love the case. Only complaint would be they stick out a bit to far of my ear but ow well, better than a wired pair of headphones. The big thing is they don’t fall out if you have them sealed in your ear correctly. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Greenbean

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great! While it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the earbuds, although a bit bulkier than expected. The sound was great, the noise cancellation was real. However after a week or so my right earbud ceased to live. I prayed to the many faced god and alas, the right earbud remained in the realm of the dead. I’d say that I’d just replace them with some new ones of the exact same model but do I want to have to return earbuds every week!? No, I won’t do it. I can’t do it. I refuse to submit to the false arrangement of promised audio ease.
customer_reviews.author: yo leo

customer_reviews.title: Awkward fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my one complaint, everything else is good. I decided to switch from an airpods to this one because the battery life (and sound) of my airpods is disappointing me. But compare to the airpods, the fit of this is super disappointing, i tried all ear tip sizes and it still keeps on falling. I've tried the medium* for a few days, but it keeps on falling so i decided to switch to small, but it still kept on falling, so now i'm at large. *When i changed the ear tip for the first time, the medium left part broke, so now i only have the large and small ear tip.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Slippery Fit
customer_reviews.text: Have been slightly disappointed with ear inserts not fitting and causing them to slides out of my ear. I’ve experimented with all three (3) sizes and can’t get a comfortable fit. I have the older ix wired headphones that have a perfect fit. I loved the more coned shaped ear pads. In fact I tried replacing them from my IX to my T5 but they don’t fit. You need to make improvements before I’ll. Onside another Klipsch headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk H.

customer_reviews.title: This are great ear bud headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and agreed and disagreed with some of the reviews. These are great ear buds and I think the bass is fine and it is a well balanced sound. Now I have not tested other buds but these are good sounding and well worth it especially in this price range. The case is well made and some thought was put into designing these ear buds and Klipch did an outstanding job.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Great Ear Buds
customer_reviews.text: These are great ear buds, They are not noise cancelling and take a bit of getting used to but once you get them to fit the way you like, the feel and sound great. What I noticed the most was the sound was very smooth and clear at all levels. The provider of this product delivered on time as promised. Great job and a note of thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.text: The earphones and the charging case are stylish, but that's about it. The earphones are full of connectivity issues, they are just useless!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Marchena

customer_reviews.title: Wait for next gen
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible do not buy them. I am going to send mine back. Even when they are paired they continue to blink an annoying blue light. Now I see why there was such a significant price drop. The case is the only good part about them. It is sturdy and cool but the buds themselves are not good. Wait for the next gen.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Fullwood

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to pair, app is also very easy to set up and sync. Fit is good - is deeper in the ear more than other ear buds, but not that uncomfortable with the right size ear tip. Bass not that thundering but it is good based on it being an ear bud (it seems only sony has been able to do bass really well in earbuds!). Sound otherwise is great, but there is not much customization from the app (only a basic equalizer). Overall I'm very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They’re just okay
customer_reviews.text: Eh, these are okay. Honestly wish I had just bought the competitive brand for a bit more money and not wasted my time. These need to be re-paired constantly, cut out all the time and disconnect any time I move sources (phone call, Spotify, meeting). They’re too much work and I wish I hadn’t bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Klipsch Fan
customer_reviews.text: I’m a Klipsch fan so I had high hopes for these. The sound was horrible compared to my wired ones and no matter what size ear piece I used I couldn’t keep them in my ear. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a very fair price!
customer_reviews.text: The first few weeks were a bit bumpy as I experienced the occasional connectivity dropouts as others have mentioned. The app came out today (March 6th) and while it took several tries to get the firmware updates to take for both sides, once done the connection is very good and the equalizer allows for tailoring of the sound to your liking. These are very comfortable as well and the price is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not worth even $25
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are junk. The initial pairing was not easy. After finally getting them to pair I listened to them for a couple hours. The sound quality was not good at all. The bass was non existant and at high volume there was noticeable distortion. I paid $79.99 for them. Wanted to like them so I gave them a few days to test. I returned the earbuds after 3 days. I would have returned them if I paid half the price I did. Would prob keep them for 20 bucks. They also look ridiculous in your ears. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley elgersma

customer_reviews.title: Awesome true wireless earbuds if it works.
customer_reviews.text: Received the first pair and like many others...couldn't pair it with the phone (Pixel 3XL). Tried numerous methods from unpairing/resetting/factory reset to no prevail. Finally gave up and contact Amazon to send it back and have a replacement pair. The replacement pair arrived and everything works great right off the bat. This unit provide awesome sound/clarity/battery life...but only if it can pair up. There's some glitches with the order of removing it from its charging case to have it turn on but it's doable.
customer_reviews.author: Super duper

customer_reviews.title: Great sound poor range connection.
customer_reviews.text: I love the battery life and it connects super fast. They are a great set of true wireless earbuds. The only bad thing about them is that they don't have a long range connection after on 12 ft they start having connection and the sound start having a distortion I had cheaper jbl and had almost 50 ft clear connection for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: erick

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: These are really hard to pair and keep paired, and don’t stay in my ears well. Definitely not suitable for use when you are moving, let alone vigorous exercise. They have failed and unpaired at critical moments. I regret buying them. The sound quality and battery life are, however, great.
customer_reviews.author: Peptide X

customer_reviews.title: Frequently falls out and stopped working after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Both my wife and I has difficulty keeping these buds in the ear even when sitting. The sound quality was less than we expected given we have other Klipsch products. Then after 3 weeks the left bud stopped working all together despite attempting to trouble shoot. Now we need to find a way to return the item after the 30 day window.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Sounded great - when they worked
customer_reviews.text: I received either a defective or a bad product overall. Within days of using these, the right bud completely stopped pairing with the left and therefore produced no sound. I followed all the steps in the poorly worded manual to perform resets, remove and re-pair, etc. I also ensured they were fully charged between attempts. I returned them in frustration and moved to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. De

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Ears
customer_reviews.text: I have had a hard time finding ear buds that do not fall out of ears while walking or exercising. The fit on the Klipsch T5 is fantastic. Some may not like the fact that they are meant to go inside the ear canal, but over the years with both wired (Etymotic mk5) and blue tooth headphones this is the only style that works for me. The sound quality is excellent and the battery life long. I found the sound better than my Samsung earbuds+ which these replaced. The charging case is made of metal and I like the look although it is quite a bit heavier than other brands that are made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Zarina

customer_reviews.title: poor fit means poor sound, experience, and overall use.
customer_reviews.text: The Klipsch T5 have the potiential to be great. But they fit terribly in your ear. They wont stay in very long once you take your hand off them to put them in your ear. Im glad i didnt pay full price for these. Then i would really be upset.Tip #1 , make the sound pole shorter. I never had a product so beautiful that performed so poorly. Kinda like having a fine girlfriend that cant dance.
customer_reviews.author: Bcarter334

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Just wow. Sounds so sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Once I got these paired and the right size ear pieces in, holy cow. They sound so damn sweet! The range is like nothing I've ever heard. And they're great for calls. No background noise for either party. Clear as day. The videos on the Klipsch site helped with pairing and fitting. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LGreen

customer_reviews.title: Short range Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the range of the Bluetooth on these (about 30 feet) compared to the S1 model (about 90 ft.) And they constantly fall out of my ears when bending over. The S1 model is less expensive but has no volume control , other than that is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Rodbw

customer_reviews.title: Good sound , but not as good as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I got these and put them in. so long as I placed them exactly correct they sounded pretty good. hard to get them into that correct position, and it gets slightly uncomfortable after a while. making use of the button function only adds to the discomfort. Got the sure set instead. not true wireless, But much better at addressing my concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: I expect more for the price
customer_reviews.text: The good : Dual audio syncs well Nice case Charge indicator Sound balance is good The bad : Cuts out on one side when someone else gets text messages on their phone nearby Is too quiet even at maximum volume Second button mapped to Siri/Bixby with no clear way to disable
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good form, iffy function
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality disappointing. Purchased AirPods Pro to compare. Range and base response sound flat compared to my new AirPods. Pains me to write this review. Huge fan of Klipsch (7.2.4 home theatre sounds better than local movie house). Pairing of L and R buds confused my Smart phone at times. Sidedness of controls doesn't make it easy... Overall nice aesthetic design and good fit. Maybe the much awaited app would have improved my experience...
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent amount of sub-bass with plenty of detail & clarity
customer_reviews.text: The sound profile on these tend to be very energetic. If you happen to have an LG V60 or a smartphone with a built-in eq you'll be able to tailor these to practically listen to all types of music. Excellent job Klipsch. You'll be hard pressed to find better sounding true wireless buds for $139.
customer_reviews.author: JoFi

customer_reviews.title: Broke very quickly
customer_reviews.text: This product broke 15 days after the Amazon return window closed. Not sure what to do now. One ear bud refuse to charge or activate. It just stopped working. The other one still works. updated 6/23/20 - i was informed that i don't qualify for the manufacturer warrant since the vendor I purchased it from Savvy Sales is not an authorized vendor to sell the Klipsch T5. They would not honor the 1yr warranty since they don't know who the vendor obtained the product and that it could be a fake.
customer_reviews.author: Roy C.

customer_reviews.title: Confusing setup  and update but good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ws confusing cause of the R and L showing separately always even when you pair it correctly The firmware upgrade was James cause the ap would not show the updated numbers even though it was updated correctly. Had to uninstall the app and then saw the correct number. Other than those issues it's good especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Adityavikram

customer_reviews.title: Poor ear fit forced a refund
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ear buds after watching many reviews on YouTube. All were quite favorable and there’s no arguing Klipsch sound quality. But I could not get a good fit no matter which ear piece I tried. I had no choice but to return them. I replaced them with Jabra 65t. The fit is excellent, the noise canceling impressive for ear buds and the sound is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Mines

customer_reviews.title: Great for their first try
customer_reviews.text: I've been listening for about 30 hours on the Klipsch T5 True Wireless Earbuds and I've only ran into a few issues, they advertise it to have about a 30 ft range and id say thats possible if there are no walls in between you and your phone or Bluetooth source, if so they get choppy really fast, also the L to R connection can be finicky fairly often which I have seen about in other reviews it will cut out audio randomly in my experience but its not so much that its not listenable, the sound quality is rich as you would expect with klipsch and with the proper ear tips you will get rich bass.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Keithley

customer_reviews.title: JUST DON’T.
customer_reviews.text: DON’T GET THESE! They had great reviews, as Klipsch has a great reputation for sound quality. However, the size and fit is terrible! You end of walking around looking like a Sci Fi character with these earbuds hanging out of your ears that blink blue light. Then, the connection keeps breaking up. One bud will work, the other won’t. I’m constantly putting in the case, taking back out and resetting. You can’t do cardio in them because as mentioned above, the fit is terrible and they fall out. Just spend the money and get Airpods. I’m so disappointed in these.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Harder

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome earbuds!! Great sound quality. Could use a tiny bit more bass, but overall they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: chris lynn

customer_reviews.title: Low sound quality for price, audio/video sync delay. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality was unacceptably low for the price of $200. I returned them not only because of that, but because they also had a delay on YouTube videos, something my $50 wireless earbuds didn’t even have trouble with. The battery life is decent, design is solid for passive noise canceling, but I would not recommend these to anyone for $200, I wouldn’t recommend it at all until the audio video sync issue is fixed too
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch has great audio just doesn’t keep you connected.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. Just like any product from Klipsch they have great build quality, great sound to them. Way better than AirPods and similar headphones. The case is nice and solid aluminum and looks very classy. The only downside to them is connectivity. They will be playing just fine and then one will cut out and may cut back in immediately or may never come back on. All you have to do is reset them by putting them in the case but it can be very annoying. If that didn’t happen these would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Sound & Battery life is pretty good the bass is low but i usually lower bass so that's not bad the downside is their quality control out of the 4 (2 from me and 2 from my buddy) 3 of them had issues and had to be returned
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality but be ready to constantly “repair”
customer_reviews.text: I have been a long time Klipsch loyalist, for the last 18 years but these earbuds severely lack the integrity I expected. Sound quality is great... when they work. I’m using an iPhone XR and they constantly drop connection. Left or Right or Both. If I pause what I’m listening to or toggle to another app briefly they disconnect and I have to pair them again. And I have updated the firmware. These are the worst pieces of stuff I’ve ever owned. NOT what I have trusted in Klipsch products over the last couple of decades.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Raye

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.  Fancy case but not sound quality expected from Klipsch
customer_reviews.text: I have several gripes for these wireless headphones. 1. It is advertised that the Klipsch app has an EQ function for these ear buds. Not true. The only thing the app does is help you pair. 2. Sound quality is not poor, but not what I expect from Klipsch. I have a pair of wired bluetooth earbuds from Skull candy that sound just as good as these. No noticeable difference. 3. The buttons on the earbuds are clunky and you have to click them pretty hard to use them. I'm returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: When I first listen to it though it wasn’t comparable to the air pods but after I listen to more music wow these are great and sometimes I though the headphones wasn’t in my ear good price for headphones !
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great set of earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I bought these even after reading reviews stating the bass quality was not that great. I am an audiophile and the bass reproduction on these are exceptional. I listen to Jazz, R & B, Hip-hop, Classical, and Pop. Once I received them I turned on my Migos station and was pleased but I know how to work my advanced sound settings on my phone to get great sound. Great sound and the pairing was the simplest process I have ever had to do on any device. These earbuds moved up to the #1 spot for me and will replace my regular set, I have three sets of earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: dUVON m. tUCKER

customer_reviews.title: Fit was an issue
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on these after reading reviews. The design and battery life are great. I could not get a good fit with the ear tips despite trying different combinations. I got great sound when pressing the ear buds into my ear but after that, I got a tin like sounds. They also fell out a few times while walking. Another issue was the left ear bud. It would loose the Bluetooth connection frequently. If I could have gotten a better fit, I would have kept them. Will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Steven F

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch user for 30 years, NOTHING BETTER !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these earbuds. Whether it's jazz, philharmonic, hip hop, rock, or alternative, these are the BEST on the market. No more getting tangled up in cords, earbuds in ears, phone in pocket, gone...BOOM 💥
customer_reviews.author: NRA Guy

customer_reviews.title: Left ear bud cuts out.
customer_reviews.text: I only used these for an hour or so until I couldn't take it anymore. The left earbud cuts out when my head is at a certain angle and doesn't turn on again until I move it. I will definitely be returning these. I wanted to like them but that is definitely a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: John Schimminger

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth drops out!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the case. The earbuds fit OK. the problem was the earbuds kept dropping the bluetooth signal. Even with the Samsung phone in my hand the earbuds would be have intermittent static and even drop out. I had to return. I bought Samsung earbuds that just came out...perfect connection. so who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a dilemma...
customer_reviews.text: Listen, I don’t do this. Ppl who jump on every opportunity they get to pass judgement & critique the work of others, for the “sole benefit” of complete strangers... just really grosses me out. Sorry, not sorry. So, as much as it pains me to say... I NEED you to know, the T5’s are straight BANGERS & Klipsch has ROCKED MY WORLD!!!
customer_reviews.author: Constantine

product_meta.title: Klipsch T5 True Wireless Rear closure S,M,L silver
product_meta.description: Colour Name:silverT5 true wireless designed for indianapolis u.s.a. From the same team of acoustic engineers who have been making the best hi-fi speakers in the world for years. T5 true wirless are born with the precise intent of returning all the details and depth of your favorite music completely wireless. With your choice of digital voice assistant, the incredible 8-hour battery life, precious metal charging case and klipsch connect app to customize your sound, the t5 true wireless is the ultimate combination of comfort, design, efficiency and unrivaled acoustic performance. T5 true wireless earphones come with a fast charging USB-C case that offers up to 3 full charge cycles. With compatibility with the klipsch connect app, 4 microphones with clear voice chat and an instant connection to siri, google voice assistant, alexa or any other digital assistant you choose, make your day smarter than ever. T5 true wireless headset rotates 360 degrees and fits any user and is water resistant. True true true wirless sound

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
